attributes.action: take the lead by showing that when people in public life speak well they will be heard and understood properly by many more listeners.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Politicians and staff employed within the radio and TV industry are in their jobs to communicate their ideas to others. We need an example set at the highest level to show that people in the privileged position of speaking in public will achieve a greater effect if they improve the quality of their spoken language.

In latter years there has been a significant degradation in the quality of the spoken word heard in everyday life.  It is becoming ever more difficult to understand what is said on the radio and television as the quality of enunciation and diction diminishes.

While regional and local accents and dialects are usually pleasant to hear, the excessive use of glottal stops (.. he’s go. a forced way of speaking ..) and 'w' instead of 'l' (.. 'peopoow' for 'people', 'powicy' for 'policy' and 'canow' for 'canal' ..) become a distraction for the listener which severely reduces the likelihood that the thoughts of the speaker will be transferred safely.  The speaker has simply wasted breath and effort.

reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
